experiences.title: Traditional Cochinita Pibil Cooking Class
experiences.short_description: Learn to prepare authentic Yucatecan cochinita pibil in a family home
experiences.long_description: Join Doña María, a third-generation Yucatecan cook, in her traditional family kitchen. You'll learn the ancient art of preparing cochinita pibil, marinating pork in achiote paste and cooking it wrapped in banana leaves. The experience includes a visit to the local market to buy fresh ingredients, hands-on cooking, and enjoying your creation with handmade tortillas. Maria will share stories of her grandmother's recipes and the cultural significance of this iconic dish.
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Hidden Cenotes Adventure by Bike
experiences.short_description: Bike through Mayan villages to discover secret cenotes known only to locals
experiences.long_description: Escape the tourist crowds and explore three pristine cenotes that few visitors know about. Carlos, a local guide born and raised in a nearby village, will lead you on a 15km bike ride through scenic countryside, small Mayan communities, and jungle paths. Each cenote offers a unique experience: one for swimming, one for cliff jumping, and one sacred cenote where we'll learn about Mayan cosmology. The tour includes fresh fruit, water, and a traditional lunch at a local family's home.
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 48 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Mayan Embroidery Workshop with Artisan Women
experiences.short_description: Learn traditional hipil embroidery techniques from Mayan women artisans
experiences.long_description: Visit a cooperative of Mayan women artisans who are preserving centuries-old embroidery traditions. Isabel and her team will teach you the symbolic meanings behind the traditional patterns and guide you in creating your own embroidered piece. Learn about the natural dyes made from local plants, the significance of different motifs, and the role of embroidery in Mayan culture. You'll take home your handmade creation and support the economic empowerment of indigenous women.
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Sunset at Uxmal with Local Archaeologist
experiences.short_description: Private tour of Uxmal ruins at sunset with a Mayan archaeologist
experiences.long_description: Experience Uxmal like never before with Dr. Juan Caamal, a Mayan archaeologist who has worked on excavations at the site for over 15 years. This intimate tour (max 4 people) takes place during the golden hour, when most tourists have left. Juan will reveal hidden details, debunk common myths, and share cutting-edge archaeological discoveries. Learn to read the carved glyphs, understand the astronomical alignments, and hear stories passed down through his family. End the evening watching the sunset from the Pyramid of the Magician.
included: Exclusive access to restricted area (subject to availability)
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 48 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Flamingo Watching & Seafood at Celestún
experiences.short_description: Boat tour to see thousands of flamingos in their natural habitat
experiences.long_description: Venture to the Celestún Biosphere Reserve, home to one of the largest flamingo colonies in Mexico. Roberto, a licensed boat captain and bird expert, will navigate the mangrove channels to get you up close to these magnificent pink birds. You'll also spot herons, pelicans, and possibly crocodiles. After the 2-hour boat tour, enjoy fresh ceviche and grilled fish at Roberto's family restaurant right on the beach. This experience supports local conservation efforts – 5% of proceeds go to flamingo habitat protection.
requirements: Comfortable shoes that can get wet
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Street Food Tour: Tacos, Marquesitas & More
experiences.short_description: Taste the best street food in Mérida with a local foodie guide
experiences.long_description: Discover why Mérida is becoming Mexico's next great food destination on this guided street food tour. Alejandra, a food blogger and Mérida native, will take you to her favorite spots that tourists never find. Try authentic panuchos, salbutes, and brazo de reina from decades-old street stalls. Sample sweet marquesitas (crispy crepes) from the famous 'Marquesitas Neri.' Learn the difference between Yucatecan and Mexican cuisine while exploring historic neighborhoods. This isn't a restaurant tour – it's where locals really eat!
not_included: Additional food or drinks beyond tastings
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Beekeeping & Honey Tasting with Melipona Bees
experiences.short_description: Learn about sacred Mayan stingless bees and taste rare melipona honey
experiences.long_description: Meet Don Pedro, a fifth-generation melipona beekeeper preserving an ancient Mayan tradition. Unlike European honeybees, melipona bees are stingless and were considered sacred by the Maya. Visit Don Pedro's meliponario (bee sanctuary) to learn about these fascinating creatures, their medicinal honey, and the threats they face. You'll observe the bees up close (they don't sting!), taste different types of melipona honey, and learn how this tradition is being passed to younger generations. This experience supports the conservation of native bee species.
included: Small jar of melipona honey to take home
requirements: No bee allergies (though bees are stingless)
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience

experiences.title: Hammock Weaving with Master Artisan
experiences.short_description: Learn the art of Yucatecan hammock weaving from a master craftsman
experiences.long_description: Discover why Yucatecan hammocks are considered the finest in the world. Guillermo has been weaving hammocks for 40 years and will show you every step of the process, from spinning the cotton thread to the intricate weaving technique. While you won't complete a full hammock (that takes weeks!), you'll create a small woven piece and gain deep appreciation for this craft. Guillermo will share stories of how hammock-making shaped Yucatecan culture and the challenges facing artisans today. Optional: purchase an authentic hammock directly from the maker.
included: Your woven piece to take home
experiences.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 24 hours before the experience
